answer:
The vaccine for tuberculosis (TB) is not routinely available for use in Canada.  For most Canadians the risk of being exposed to TB is very low.  If you would like more information about TB in B.C., or the the vaccine for TB, you can contact your local public health unit or the BCCDC TB clinic at 604-707-2692.  
- Immunization Nurse
question: TB vaccinations for 2 adults and 2 children.Is there a price or low income families? If so what is required to prove low income as well as income tax records? We are from Pakistan and have visitors from Pakistan from time to time.Renowned Stephen Lewis says the rising TB death rate is preventable.
